title: Citi Hungary's New Premium Euro Hungarian Government Bond Offering
summary: Budapest, Hungary - Citibank Hungary's customers now have access, through Citibank branches, to the three-year Premium Euro Hungarian Government Bonds with a 5.1 percent initial annual interest rate and an investment opportunity starting at EUR100.
tag-1: Citi Hungary's New Premium Euro Hungarian Government Bond Offering
tag-2: Budapest, Hungary – Citibank Hungary's customers now have access, through Citibank branches, to the three-year Premium Euro Hungarian Government Bonds with a 5.1 percent initial annual interest rate and an investment opportunity starting at EUR100.
tag-3: Hungary's Citi Country Officer Batara Sianturi said, "This is a very attractive investment opportunity in euros given the characteristics of bond rates available in the Eurozone at this time. Including this premium euro government bond among our investment offering perfectly fits our strategy to offer our customers the most compelling investment products and services to meet their short-, mid- and long-term financial goals."
tag-4: Jon Wiggins, Consumer Business Manager for Citibank Hungary, remarked: "We already experience great customer interest in buying these bonds. Their floating rates are linked to EUROSTAT Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices, and it offers a flexible investment scheme with attractive rate opportunities even if sold before the three-year maturity. We encourage our customers to leverage the benefits this product can bring them in a well-diversified investment portfolio."
tag-5: More information about Citibank products and services are available at www.citibank.hu.
tag-6: Investment products are (i) not insured by any government agency; (ii) not a deposit or other obligation of, or guaranteed by, the depository institution or Citibank N.A. / Citigroup Inc or any of their affiliates; and (iii) subject to investment risks, including possible loss of the principal amount invested. Past performance is no guarantee for future results, prices may go up and down. Investments are only available for investors who are not citizens or permanent residents of the United States.
